entry.title: Empowering Business Users with Personalized News in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Release
entry.content:
Keeping business users informed about system and company news is essential for organizational success. When users are aware of changes that could impact their daily tasks, they can make better decisions, adapt more quickly, and boost overall productivity. Staying up to date‚Äîespecially with updates on processes, departments, or system changes‚Äîhelps eliminate confusion and ensures alignment across teams.  

While our existing news feed provides valuable updates on SAP system changes, we‚Äôve listened closely to customer feedback and enhanced communication and user experience on My Home even further. In the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, we now offer the ability to customize and manage the My Home news feed through the new Manage News application.

Manage News Application

 

Introducing the Manage News Application 

The Manage News application empowers news administrators to deliver timely, targeted information updates directly to business users via a centralized news feed. 

Key capabilities for news administrators include: 

  • Create, manage, and publish news articles: Administrators can compose news posts to be displayed on My Home, controlling the flow of critical company and system updates. 
  • Control visibility and importance: News items can be marked as critical, ensuring essential information is highlighted and receives appropriate attention from business users. 
  • Plan and schedule communications: Administrators can organize when specific news should be published, enabling timely and organized delivery of updates. 
  • Language adaptation: Messages can be tailored in all company-supported languages, ensuring effective communication across diverse user groups. 
  • Targeted audience assignment: News can be assigned to specific App Transaction codes, so only users with access to the corresponding Fiori apps or transaction codes will see relevant news items. 
  • Organize news by groups or categories: News articles can be grouped into categories such as Finance or Human Resources, making it easy for users to find pertinent information. 
  • Visual enhancements: Administrators can upload images aligned with news topics to make posts more engaging and visually informative. 

News article creation in Manage News Application

 

What Business Users Will Experience 

The My Home news feed now displays articles created by news administrators, neatly organized into designated categories. Critical updates are clearly marked with an eye-catching critical marker to ensure users notice and prioritize these messages. 

This personalized news feature centralizes essential communications in one place, tailored to the needs of each user based on their system app access. By delivering relevant, timely information directly to business users, organizations can foster a more informed and agile workforce. 

 Critical News displayed in My Home News Feed 

Critical News Article in My Home News dialog

 

Benefits for Your Organization 

With the Manage News application, administrators can tailor the news feed to reflect the specific needs of your company or organization, enabling more effective communication with business users. This streamlined and targeted approach to information sharing helps: 

  • Improve user awareness and decision-making 
  • Minimize confusion and misalignment across teams 
  • Increase adaptability to system or process changes 
  • Enhance overall company performance 

 

Prerequisites 

To access the Manage News application users or administrators will have to be assigned to the SAP_CORE_BC_CUX_NWS_MNG_PC business catalogue. For business users to view the news feed on My Home they will have to be assigned SAP_CORE_BC_CUX_NWS_DSP_PC catalogue. The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE role will already have SAP_CORE_BC_CUX_NWS_DSP_PC business catalogue assigned. With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, news maintained in the Manage News application will be displayed by default for all customers who have not configured a RSS feed or SAP Custom System News. To display the news from the Manage News application the 'Manage News App' setting needs to be enabled via UI Adaptation mode (Adapt UI in the User Actions menu). Users or administrator must have the catalog SAP_CORE_BC_EXT_FLEX attached to their role to access the UI Adaptation key user capabilities. 

My Home UI Adaptation Mode News Feed Settings

 

We‚Äôre excited to bring this powerful new communication feature to you with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release and look forward to seeing how it helps your business stay connected and informed. 

If you are interested in hearing about the latest innovations in SAP Cloud ERP, please join our Public Cloud Practitioner Forum in which SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customers share best practices and provide feedback to the SAP development teams about new functionality. 

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/public-cloud-means-continuous-innovation-and-continuous-learning-new-user/ba-p/14017362 

(Open to SAP Cloud ERP customers, including partners running SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.) 

Caroline Welsh, and Suneet Agarwal  on behalf of the SAP UX Foundations responsible for My Home in SAP S/4HANA.

entry.title: Quality Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP¬¥s ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution. SAP S/4HANS Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem ‚Äì customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

This release introduces a groundbreaking feature: SAP Document AI. The generative AI-powered document processing capability revolutionizes the way businesses manage and process quality certificates, handling them in all formats seamlessly within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Designed to extract relevant information and automatically identify corresponding quality certificates, this solution empowers businesses to streamline their processes and achieve remarkable operational efficiencies.



Leveraging generative AI with SAP Document AI

With the launch of the SAP Document AI capability in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, businesses can now enjoy a new advantage in processing quality certificates. The innovation empowers users to enhance productivity in processing quality certificates while reducing production loss attributable to material inspection delays.

By harnessing the power of generative AI, this feature reduces the time required to process incoming certificates, thereby allowing quality technicians to concentrate on their core functions. This effectively reduces manual effort and associated processing costs. Furthermore, the automation provided by SAP Document AI ensures that no certificates are lost or overlooked, augmenting quality control mechanisms and minimizing errors due to improperly assigned objects.

Through efficient extraction and structuring of information from various quality certificates, SAP Document AI streamlines stock release processes with quicker quality certificate confirmation. The AI-driven solution facilitates the automatic extraction of data from paper or PDF quality certificates, transferring the extracted data into a smart processing queue for seamless handling. Whether through automated processing or intelligent error management, the executed transactions are both reliable and agile.

 

Streamlining certificate management processes

Beyond its AI capabilities, the innovation also introduces application-level improvements that enhance inbound logistics workflows.. By instantly generating certificate receipt confirmation using extracted data, the system ensures a swift and reliable integration of quality certificates into the workflow. Application data is utilized to accurately locate the corresponding quality certificate data records within the SAP system, and these records are efficiently mapped to the quality certificates in the queue. This functionality further enhances the accuracy and efficiency of the document management process

Certificates receive a status update to "received," with the quality certificate document being attached to the relevant system data record. The solution also provides enhanced flexibility, enabling customers to transfer defects to a variety of quality notifications seamlessly.

 

 

AI-powered document processing for incoming supplier quality certificates

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release marks a significant milestone in the digital evolution of quality certificate processing. By integrating generative AI technology into business processes, the AI-powered document processing for incoming supplier quality certificates elevates productivity, accuracy, and reliability while reducing the time and effort involved in managing quality certificates. 

 

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series! 

From July 21 to July 25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for Manufacturing as well as 20 other topics of interest. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand‚Äìanywhere, anytime.

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 3: Beta AI Innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
This third post in my series gives an overview of the very latest user experience innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, which are so new that they are only released for customers to try them out via beta testing. They are all AI-related, for My Home, for working with SAP Fiori elements based applications, as well as for some individual application use cases.

In case you missed them, Part 2 covers the generally available UX innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, and Part 1 explains how users in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition can query SAP Analytics Cloud directly via Joule, as well as providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services.

This post covers these innovations for:

My Home

  • AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home.
  • AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications.

SAP Fiori elements based applications

  • AI-assisted easy fill.
  • AI-assisted error explanation.

Individual application uses cases

  • AI-assisted payment exception analysis.
  • Accounting accruals agent.

If you want to try out these features as beta testers, then sign-up for beta testing here:

  • Q3/25: Latest AI-assisted user experience features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508

Find out more about beta programs and how to Get Involved Early with SAP innovations in general.

 

My Home UX Innovations

AI-Assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home

With this feature, you can now get details of a Business Situation shown directly in place on My Home, and even initiate quick actions or make changes to business data there. This is achieved by expanding the Situation card on My Home when you click on it, as you can see in Figure 1, or in action in this video:

  • Video: AI-Assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (1:00 min.)

Figure 1: Beta: AI-Assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home. Alt Text: An image with two screenshots: the upper one shows the top part of My Home showing three Situation cards in the To-Dos section. One titled ‚ÄúThis sales quotation is about to expire‚Äù is highlighted and linked with an arrow to an expanded card shown in the second screenshot ‚Äì the card is taller and wider, contains a summary on the left with three action buttons ‚ÄúChange Validity‚Äù, ‚ÄúReject All Items‚Äù, ‚ÄúClose Situation‚Äù, and more details on the right.

AI-Assisted Smart Personalization of My Home for Applications

So far, as I outlined in Part 2, you can use natural language and AI to personalize your My Home by adding Insights Cards. Now, with this beta functionality, you can use natural language to find and add applications and insights tiles.

If you have the functionality activated in your system, you‚Äôll see the AI button ‚ÄúAdd Content‚Äù in the salutation bar at the top of My Home, as shown at the top of Figure 2. Clicking on this brings a pop-over with the option to add Insights Cards or, as shown, Apps & Insights Tiles. By describing what you want to do, the system will propose suitable applications and Insights Tiles. If you select them and click ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù, they will be added, either as an entry in your Apps Favorites section, or in the Insights Tiles section. Figure 2 shows these main steps.

Figure 2: Beta: AI-Assisted Smart Personalization of My Home for Applications. Alt Text: The image shows three screenshots: at the top an extract of My Home showing the blue salutation bar, with an AI button ‚ÄúAdd Content‚Äù on the right. An arrow has been added linking it to the second screenshot, where a popover ‚ÄúAdd Content‚Äù is shown, where the user has entered ‚ÄúI want to monitor sales orders what app should I use to do this‚Äù, and two of four results are listed and visualized: ‚ÄúTrack Sales Orders‚Äù and ‚ÄúManage Sales Orders‚Äù (shown as an insight tile). Below that a screenshot of the outcome in My Home: the former is added to Apps Favorites, the latter to Insights Tiles.

 Watch a demo:

  • Video: AI-Assisted Smart Personalization of My Home for Applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (1:11 min.)

 For a summary of all the news for My Home, both generally available and for beta-testing, read this blog post:

  • My Home in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 - What's new?

 

AI UX Innovations for Applications based on SAP Fiori elements

AI-Assisted Easy Fill

Users often receive requests via e-mails or chats to change data in the system. This new feature makes it much easier to update the fields in the various sections of an object page based on SAP Fiori elements, such as a sales order. Instead of manually scanning the e-mail and navigating to the relevant sections and fields in the object page, you can just paste the text into Easy Fill and it will automatically identify the correct fields to update, with proposals for the correct entries.

The power of AI means that the new values do not have to be exactly contained in the text. Figure 3 shows an example, where the new address is given without actually mentioning the name of the city, only the street and post code, along with an abbreviation for the state and country (‚ÄúBW DE‚Äù). As you can see, the proposed new values are correct, despite this missing or abbreviated information.

Figure 3: Beta: AI-Assisted Easy Fill for SAP Fiori elements based applications. Alt-Text: A screenshot showing an Easy Fill pop-over, with a text entry field on the left with text from a customer e-mail informing about a change of name and address for their store, and on the left showing the ‚ÄúFilled Fields‚Äù, a list of seven fields for which new values are proposed.

Watch a demo:

  • Video: AI-Assisted Easy Fill of SAP Fiori Elements-Based Applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (1:15 min.)

Note that this feature is only available for applications based on SAP Fiori elements.

AI-Assisted Error Explanation

We started beta testing for this with the 2502 release, and have decided to continue with beta testing in this 2508 release. The explanation I gave in my February blog post continues to apply:

New users who are unfamiliar with the system may find that the short error messages give too little information for them to fully understand the issue, and what to do about it. The AI-Assisted Error Explanation (beta) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition summarizes information which explains the error and provide a recommendation for how to resolve it. Figure 8 shows an example where a user has entered a Sold-to-Party ID which does not exist in the system.

Note that this feature is also only available for applications based on SAP Fiori elements.

Figure 4: Beta: AI-Assisted Error Explanation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502. ALT Text: On the left part of a data entry screen is shown, with the field ‚ÄúSold-to Party containing ‚ÄúABC‚Äù marked red and below that a  popover with an error message ‚ÄúNo customer master record exists for sold-to-party ABC‚Äù, and in the text line below that the AI icon followed by ‚ÄúGenerate Explanation‚Äù. A fat arrow leads from this text to the image on the right, which indicates what happens when you click on this text: you get a popover with an short Explanation section and a longer Resolution section with numbered actions.

If you want a summary of the latest such generic AI-assisted features, both generally available and for beta-testing, with some different examples, have a look at this blog post:

  • Try the latest AI features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.

 

AI Innovations in Individual Application Use Cases

AI-Assisted Payment Exception Analysis

Most payments of invoices from vendors are automated, but sometimes data is missing or incorrect so that an automatic payment fails. These issues are collected in error logs, and one of the more tedious tasks of Accounts Payable Accountant is to scan through these error logs, understand what went wrong and why, and then fix it.

With AI-assisted payment exception analysis, we make this task much easier and less tedious: users can choose an entry in the error log and simply click on the AI button ‚ÄúAnalyze Exception‚Äù. The system then provide an analysis, a recommended resolution in natural language, as well as a links to a selection of the most relevant log entries. If a user wants all the relevant logs, they are just one click away. Figure 5 shows what this looks like:

Figure 5: Beta: AI-assisted payment exception analysis. Alt Text: A screenshot of the Revise Payment Proposals applicatin, showing a list of payment exceptions grouped by Error ID. Four error IDs are listed, covering 419 exceptions. One is expanded and has one exception listed in the row below. The main part of the image is a pop-over ‚ÄúException Analysis and Resolution‚Äù, with natural language explanations in sections ‚ÄúAnalysis‚Äù and ‚ÄúResolution‚Äù and a section ‚ÄúLogs‚Äù with a list of selected logs, and a button to select ‚ÄúAll Logs‚Äù.

Alternatively, watch this:

  • Video: AI-assisted payment exception analysis (1:20 min.)

Accounting Accruals Agent

An accrual is an accounting entry which represents revenue which has been earned or expenses which have incurred but for which no payment has yet been made. That way, when looking at a particular period such as a quarter or a month, accountants get a more accurate picture of a company‚Äôs financial position. For example, if a service was delivered, but not paid for within the period, having the accrual means that the cost of delivering the service and the revenue associated with it both appear in the summary for the period.

Calculating accruals and deferrals is often time very time consuming. It can also require estimates based on historical data, if for example invoices have not yet been created, or payment amounts can be reduced if payments are made quickly in the future.

The new accounting accruals agent can significantly speed this up, potentially reducing the time spent on these activities by 80%! This frees up accountants to work on more value-adding activities, such as analysis. As you can see in Figure 6, the agent creates a list of accrual proposals. For each proposal, you can details on the recommendation, including an explanation for the basis of the recommendation.

Figure 6: Beta: Accrual Proposals made by the accounting accruals agent. Alt Text: A screenshot of the Accrual Proposals applications, showing a list of six accrual proposals on the left. The details of the one selected are shown on the right, showing the recommended accrual amount, the proposed line items and a section ‚ÄúBasis of AI Recommendation‚Äù with a natural language explanation along with a bar chart and a forecast line for the trend per month.

Watch this video to find out more:

  • Video: Accounting Accruals Agent (1:36 min.)

 

Continue Reading - UX Innovations in SAP SuccessFactors

I hope you enjoyed this third part, covering the new UX innovations available for beta testing with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508. Here is the link to part four, covering exciting new UX innovations available in the SAP Success Factors 1H2025 release:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 4: SAP SuccessFactors (AI, Joule and More).

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution.  

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem‚Äìcustomers, partners, and SAP experts.  

 

In this blog post I‚Äôd like to outline the innovations for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 in the area of Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management. These are the topics that are covered:

  • Efficient project plan scheduling: Calculate dates for project structure elements in a project plan (6JN)
  • Embedding content in SAP Project and Resource Management (6JN)
  • Monitoring and comprehensive insights with project financial booklets (1NT) 
  • Creation of WBS elements across company codes for revenue projects (1NT) 
  • Create billing plan dates from project milestones‚Äã (1NT) 
  • Further innovations

 

Check out my video to get a glimpse of the new features:

 

 

In the dynamic world of business, the ability to efficiently manage portfolios and projects is a crucial determinant of success. It's here that SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, steps in as a transformative solution, offering a comprehensive suite of innovations designed to help businesses streamline operations, enhance financial insight, and foster collaboration. This blog post delves into these groundbreaking innovations, emphasizing their business value and how they empower end-users to achieve unparalleled efficiency and effectiveness.

Enhancements in SAP Project and Resource Management

Efficient project plan scheduling: Calculate dates for project structure elements in a project plan

At the core of successful project management is the ability to schedule and manage timelines effectively. The latest release introduces new scheduling capabilities such as backward and bottom-up scheduling within SAP Project and Resource Management. For project managers, this enhanced scheduling functionalities ensure precise timeline predictions, they reduce project delays and pave the way for timely completions. By automating scheduling, project managers can focus on strategic tasks, improving overall project efficiency. As a nice side effect, more reliable schedules, conflicts and resource contention are minimized.

You can also find more information in the blog post provided by my colleague Ellen Reuther.

 

Figure 1: Enhanced scheduling functionalities such as backward and bottom-up scheduling optimizes project planning. 

 

Embedding content in SAP Project and Resource Management

Moreover, embedded content in SAP Project and Resource Management offers significant efficiency boost for project management through customization.

You can integrate custom dashboards directly into SAP to display essential KPIs seamlessly, enhancing focus and reducing the need to switch applications. You can also modify project management interfaces as business needs evolve, ensuring continuous alignment with objectives. Embedded content remains fully functional post-system upgrades, minimizing technical disruptions and preserving focus on core tasks.

You can also find more information in the help.

 

Figure 2: Flexible extension capabilities allow for seamless integration of custom content directly within SAP applications.

 

Enhancements in Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

Monitoring and comprehensive insights with project financial booklets

The new application ‚ÄúProject Financial Booklet ‚Äì Enterprise Projects‚Äù is designed for project controllers and accountants, offering insights into project profitability through multidimensional analysis. This application provides three pivotal views, each delivering a granular perspective on financial health:

  • Project margin overview
  • Project billing element view
  • Project budget availability control (AVC),

 

This enables you to conduct deep profitability analyses, allowing you to quickly identify and act on top-performing projects. The flexibility of its filtering and customization options ensures that you can tailor reports to align with specific business objectives, thereby enhancing decision-making accuracy.

Figure 3: Leveraging conditional formatting as part of the project budget AVC view brings any alerts immediately to your attention.

 

Moreover, the innovation's real-time conditional formatting acts as a proactive alert system, helping you to stay ahead of potential financial risks by highlighting critical figures like budget utilization. Its seamless integration with other applications promotes efficient navigation and a holistic perspective on the project environment. By fostering early trend detection and anomaly recognition, this tool enables project managers to make informed, strategic decisions, thereby reducing financial risks and improving resource allocation. Overall, the booklet empowers businesses to drive efficiency, optimize budget management, and ultimately enhance profitability, making it a pivotal advancement in project financial oversight. Currently, this functionality is available for sales accountants only, but it‚Äôs planned to be available for project financial controllers with the future release.

 

Figure 4: Explore the different views as part of the new project financial booklet ensuring efficient project analysis.

 

Creation of WBS elements across company codes for revenue projects

With SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, we allow users to create Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) elements that span multiple company codes specifically for revenue projects. This capability was previously available for overhead, statistical, and investment projects, but is now extended to revenue projects.

A significant feature is that within a single billing hierarchy of a project, only one company code is maintained, ensuring that profitability can be viewed in the local currency of the company code. If an overarching view of the project‚Äôs profitability is desired, it can be evaluated in a global currency or project currency. In practical terms, this allows for the execution of a single revenue project using multiple legal entities, enhancing the flexibility and complexity with which projects can be managed and structured across different geographical areas or business units.

The system includes validations to ensure compliance, such as ensuring that a single billing hierarchy isn't assigned multiple company codes. This feature supports API capability, meaning that project creation and management can also be done through external systems, maintaining the integrity of this multi-company code structure. These enhancements help streamline project execution and profitability analysis across diverse company codes in global organizations. 

 

Figure 5: The creation of WBS elements across company codes is enabled for revenue projects.

 

Create billing plan dates from project milestones

This innovation aims to improve synchronization between project management and billing processes. It allows users to integrate project milestones directly with sales order billing plans, creating a seamless connection between project progress and billing schedules. By doing so, it ensures that billing can be triggered automatically upon milestone completion, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in financial transactions.

Project managers and finance teams can get real-time visibility into billing and revenue forecasts based on project status. Furthermore, manual interventions and potential errors related to billing alignments are reduced. The feature is designed to support revenue recognition processes by aligning project deliverables with contractual billing terms, thereby optimizing cash flow management. Overall, this innovation is part of a broader effort to streamline enterprise project management within the SAP ecosystem, ensuring tight integration across corporate functions.

 

Figure 6: Execute revenue projects via multiple legal entities: Create billing plan items based on project milestones.  

 

Further innovations

Extending project control ‚Äì Enterprise projects application

With the ‚ÄúProject Control ‚Äì Enterprise Projects‚Äù application you can now enable SAP UI5 adaptation. This enhancement allows for the creation of application variants via the SAPUI adaptation project, granting flexibility without altering the original source.

Changes made are reflected in artifacts representing only the updates, not the entire application, and are handled within the SAP Business Application Studio. This ensures that the modifications are seamless, maintaining the integrity and performance of the original application. For further information, please refer to Extending SAP Fiori Applications | SAP Help Portal


Use extended situation handling for enterprise projects

We have enhanced the situation handling framework by allowing self-modeled situation templates within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud environment. This feature aims to address operational inefficiencies and errors that result from manual oversight in enterprise project execution phases. By enabling key users to create custom situation use cases that align with specific business scenarios, the system helps to proactively mitigate risks such as delays and demand fluctuations. Read more in this blog post by my colleague Mark Huang.


Deprecation of resource-related intercompany billing

With SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 we have deprecated the traditional resource-related intercompany billing and are introducing a successor model that offers greater flexibility and transparency.

This new approach is easily activated through configuration settings and allows continued use of existing applications and records during transition. The new model aims to streamline processes and improve financial visibility, although existing records can still be managed and used with the upgraded system. Find out how to activate the new resource-related intercompany billing here.

 

SAP Project and Resource Management enhancements

Resource managers now have the ability to set request data as fulfilled, which aids in bookkeeping by marking resource requests as completed. More insights into resource management, especially focusing on the staffing of the right employees can be found in the Miguel von Rotz‚Äôs blog post.

Moreover, we‚Äôve enhanced project management capabilities via increased API coverage for issue management and project planning, along with predefined custom fields for issue objects. Last but not least, we have made some integration improvements to further streamline processing statuses for projects, ultimately enhancing the overall management capabilities.

If you want to find out more about streamlined collaboration in ETO projects, you can also refer to the blog post published by my colleague Renato Zadro.

 

More Information

If you are interested in the latest and greatest blog posts on Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management, please have a look at my collection blog and also take a look at the Community page for Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management (Project Control).

 

üìΩWatch the Replays of Our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 Early Release Series!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

From July 21 to July 25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. entry.title: Example code for SAP_COM_0466 - Print Queue Item - Read (A2X)
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog focuses on how to get documents out from the SAP Print Queue and how to pass them on to an external Output Management System (OMS) for processing and printing using the SAP provided API. It supplements the already existing blog with example implementation with JAVA code of  SAP_COM_0466 - Print Queue Item - Read (A2X).

Example code for SAP_COM_0466 - Print Queue Item - Read (A2X)

See the details on SAP_COM_0466 | SAP Help Portal how to configure your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system to support Print Queues. 
Prerequisites: 

  • Compiled with SAPMachine 21. You can download here.
  • Download (e.g. here) and add latest version of class org.json 
  • Adapt with your personal connection and access details.  

Please note that code is meant as example how the api can be used. Code is not claimed to be complete, to be error free or to be state of the art programming style. 

Usage of the example code

  1. Download (e.g. here) and add latest version of class org.json 
  2. Adopt cope with your access details
  3. Compile code (I used SAPMachine 21).
  4. Run code
  5. Create a document on the configured print queue in SAP System
  6. Code will  process print queue item
  7. You can also simulate errors on the print queue item. See comments in the code

Remind!
Code is meant as example how the api can be used. Code is not claimed to be complete, to be error free or to be state of the art programming style. Nevertheless feedback is welcome.

import java.net.CookieManager;
import java.net.http.*;
import java.net.URI;
import java.util.Base64;
import java.util.concurrent.*; 
import org.json.*;

class SAP_COM_0466_example {
    
    public static int Get_System_Details(  System_Str[] System_Details ) throws Exception {
    // get details of the SAP sytem for api and other calls
    
        // pre-defined system details and credentials for testing, needs to be configured in SAP system beforehand
        
		System_Details[0] = new System_Str (
            "https://my######-api.s4hana.ondemand.com",                                                        // URL to SAP system DEF
            "SAPUSERNAME",                                                                                     // SAP User Name / Client ID on BTP
            "########################################",                                                        // SAP User Password / Client Secret on BTP
            "SAP S/4HANA CLOUD (Public Edition)",                                                              // SAP System Type

    public static int Get_Bearer_Token( StringBuilder BearerToken, String Credentials, System_Str System_Details ) throws Exception {
    // For BTP only to get the bearer token for oauth authentication 

        String       UrlLocator;                                                                               // http request url
        HttpRequest  RequestBody;                                                                              // http request body
        HttpHeaders  RequestHeaders;                                                                           // http request header
        HttpResponse ResponseReply;                                                                            // http reply body
        HttpHeaders  ResponseHeaders;                                                                          // http reply header
        String       ResponseCodeL;                                                                            // http response code
        String       BearerTokenL;                                                                             // BTP bearer token for oauth authentication
        
        UrlLocator = System_Details.SystemUrl.substring(System_Details.SystemUrl.indexOf("api.") + 4);         // extract location of BTP account
        UrlLocator = UrlLocator.substring(0,UrlLocator.indexOf("."));                                 
        UrlLocator = "https://" + System_Details.SubDomain + ".authentication." + UrlLocator + ".hana.ondemand.com"; // build url for bearer token request
        //System.out.println(UrlLocator + "/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials");              
                                                                                                      
        RequestBody = HttpRequest.newBuilder()                                                                 // build the http request
        .uri(URI.create( UrlLocator + "/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials"))                           // add path for bearer token request
        .version(HttpClient.Version.HTTP_2)                                                                    // set call context
        .header("Content-Type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
        .header("accept", "application/xml")
        .header("user-agent", "printqueuequery")
        .header("Authorization", Credentials)
        .method("GET", HttpRequest.BodyPublishers.noBody())
        .build();

        RequestHeaders  = RequestBody.headers();                                                               // read the request header for error analysis 
        ResponseReply   = HttpClient.newHttpClient().send(RequestBody, HttpResponse.BodyHandlers.ofString());  // initiate http call
        ResponseHeaders = ResponseReply.headers();                                                             // read the reply header for error analysis    
        ResponseCodeL   = ResponseReply.toString();                                                            
        ResponseCodeL   = ResponseCodeL.substring(ResponseCodeL.length()-3,ResponseCodeL.length());            // extract http status code

        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("Get_Bearer_Token");
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("HttpRequest");    
        //System.out.println(RequestBody);        
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("RequestHeaders");
        //System.out.println(RequestHeaders);
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("ResponseReply");    
        //System.out.println(ResponseReply);    
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("ResponseBody");    
        //System.out.println(ResponseReply.body());    
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("ResponseHeaders");
        //System.out.println(ResponseHeaders);
        //System.out.println("");        
        //System.out.println("BearerToken: \"" + BearerTokenL + "\"");        
        //System.out.println("");
                    
        BearerTokenL    = ResponseReply.body().toString();                                                     // extract bearer token from http reply
        if ( BearerTokenL.contains("\"access_token\":\"") )                                                    // check if bearer token is in http reply
        {
            BearerTokenL    = BearerTokenL.substring(BearerTokenL.indexOf("\"access_token\":\"")+16);          // extract bearer token
            BearerTokenL    = BearerTokenL.substring(0,BearerTokenL.indexOf("\","));
        }
        else {
            BearerTokenL    = "";
            System.out.println("    BearerToken missing in http-reply");                                       // show error message if bearer token is missing
        }

        BearerToken.setLength(0);                                                                              // return the bearer token
        BearerToken.append(BearerTokenL);
        
        return (Integer.valueOf(ResponseCodeL));                                                               // return the http status code
    }

        //System.out.println("ResponseHeaders");
        //System.out.println(ResponseHeaders);
        //System.out.println("");
    
        ICMCacheL = "";                                                                                        // extract the SAP ICM cache status from http reply

				System.out.println("error occured");                                                           // exit in case of elemd "d" does not exist

    public static int Get_PrintQueuesOfUserExt( int[] Qname_No, String[] ListOfQueues, String Credentials, System_Str System_Details ) throws Exception {

        //System.out.println("ResponseHeaders");
        //System.out.println(ResponseHeaders);
        //System.out.println("");        
        
        Qname_NoL = 0;                                                                                         // initiate the number of Print Queues
        if ( ResponseCodeL.equals("200") && (ResponseReply.body().toString().length() > 99) ) {               // check if there is payload
            if ( !ResponseReply.body().toString().contains("{\"d\":{") ) {                                     // check if proper structure is received
				System.out.println("error occured");                                                           // exit in case of elemd "d" does not exist
				System.out.println(ResponseReply.body());

			}
            JSONObject jObject = new JSONObject(ResponseReply.body().toString());                              // read the json structure
            JSONArray  Qresults = jObject.getJSONObject("d").getJSONArray("results"); 
            for (int i = 0; i < Qresults.length(); i++) {
                ListOfQueues[i]  = Qresults.getJSONObject(i).getString("Qname");                               // read the Print Queue name

            }
        }
        Qname_No[0] = Qname_NoL;                                                                               // return the number of Print Queues 
        
        return (Integer.valueOf(ResponseCodeL));                                                               // return the http status code
    }
